summary: This is a docket entry notification from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding the sealed brief filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeal (Case 20-3061). The document indicates the brief was filed under seal and provides notification details for legal personnel involved.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant appealing her case in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals, with a sealed brief filed on her behalf.

persons.name: Laura Mennen
persons.context: Listed as one of the attorneys to receive electronic notice of the sealed brief filing in the Maxwell appeal case.

persons.name: Adam Mueller
persons.context: Listed as one of the attorneys to receive electronic notice of the sealed brief filing in the Maxwell appeal case.

connections.description: Mennen is listed as an Assistant U.S. Attorney who would receive notice of Maxwell's sealed brief filing, indicating she is part of the prosecution team opposing Maxwell's appeal.
Mueller is listed as an Assistant U.S. Attorney who would receive notice of Maxwell's sealed brief filing, indicating he is part of the prosecution team opposing Maxwell's appeal.

events.title: Sealed Brief Filed in Maxwell Appeal
events.description: A sealed brief was filed on behalf of appellant Ghislaine Maxwell in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals (Case 20-3061).

events.title: Docket Activity Notification
events.description: The court system generated and sent notification of the sealed brief filing to relevant attorneys and parties.

keyFacts: A sealed brief was filed on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell in her appeal (Case 20-3061) in the Second Circuit Court of Appeals.
The brief was filed on September 24, 2020, with notification sent to attorneys on October 5, 2020.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys Laura Mennen and Adam Mueller were among those notified of the sealed filing.
